traceability.evidence: 1) All Vitest tests pass (128/128), including cli.flags.test.js (validates --min-age flag parsing, default=7, rejects invalid values), cli.config-file.test.js (validates reading minAge from .dry-aged-deps.json, CLI override, custom config-file name, JSON errors), filter-by-age.test.js (ensures filterByAge respects prodMinAge/devMinAge), and printOutdated JSON/table output tests (checks thresholds appear in JSON under summary.thresholds and in table messages). 2) Help output in bin/dry-aged-deps.js includes the line: “--min-age= Minimum age in days (1-365) for including versions (default: 7)”. 3) package JSON and src/cli-options.js wiring: loadConfigFile reads config.minAge, parseMinAgeFlag applies validation & precedence, and printOutdated uses prodMinAge/devMinAge correctly.
traceability.notes: The story 005.0-DEV-CONFIGURABLE-AGE-THRESHOLD is fully implemented. The CLI supports --min-age with correct validation and defaulting, reads minAge from .dry-aged-deps.json, applies flag-overrides, falls back to 7 days when unset, documents the flag in help/README, and surfaces the active threshold in both JSON output and human-readable messages. All acceptance criteria are satisfied and covered by unit and integration tests.
